title: Barrels - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Check that the three oil spray jets are fitted and the three oil jet protectors from
Thoroughly clean the mating surfaces of the crankcase and barrels taking care not to damage the mating surfaces.
To make sure that the piston rings do not get damaged, the piston/connecting rod assemblies must be fitted into the barrel before fitting the barrel to the engine.
Damaged piston rings may result in engine failure.

Fit the three piston and connecting rod assemblies into the barrel from the bottom as noted for removal. Make sure that the piston alignment mark on the piston faces the right hand side of the engine (away from the transmission cover).
Fit a new base gasket and refit the locating dowels as noted during removal.
With the aid of an assistant, carefully fit the barrel to the crankcase ensuring that the connecting rods fit through the crankcase without contacting any of the three oil jets.
To hold the barrel in position, fit
to the cylinder head and secure using two of the original bolts for the cylinder head.
